titles.title: Department of Defense Suicide Tracking Act of 2014
A bill to provide for improvements in the consistency of data collection, reporting, and assessment in connection with the suicide prevention efforts of the Department of Defense.
Department of Defense Suicide Tracking Act of 2014

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: Department of Defense Suicide Tracking Act of 2014 - Requires the Secretary of Defense (DOD) to submit to Congress a policy for the development of a standard method for collecting, reporting, and assessing suicide data and suicide-attempt data involving members of the Armed Forces, including reserve components, and their dependents.
